column2: HAWAII PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column4: Hawaii
column6: HI

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. You are approaching an intersection when the signal turns yellow. You should:
column4: slow down and proceed with caution through the intersection.
column6: speed up to get through the intersection before the red light comes on.
column8: stop then enter the intersection when safe to do so.

column2: 2. This sign means:
column4: Left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column6: Winding road ahead.
column8: The road will curve to the right.

column2: 3. You want to turn left at an intersection ahead. A car reaches the intersection from the opposite direction and moves straight ahead. You:
column4: must wait for the car to go through before you turn.
column6: must make a U-turn and then turn right.
column8: can turn left. You have the right of way.
column10: may not enter the intersection to prepare for your left turn if the light is green.

column2: 4. If a traffic officer signals you to drive through a red light:
column4: you must do it.
column6: you must call the police.
column8: you must wait for the red light to turn green.
column10: you must not obey the officer. Signs and signals take precedence over directions given by traffic officers.

column2: 5. Bicyclists must refrain from:
column4: riding in the roadway in a school zone.
column6: carrying passengers unless the bicycle is equipped to do so.
column8: riding in the roadway in a construction zone.

column2: 6. When drivers see this road sign:
column4: they must turn around immediately.
column6: they must come to a complete stop and call the police.
column8: they must treat it as a 4-Way Stop sign.
column10: they must not drive past this sign.

column2: 7. Defensive driving is a driving technique in which you as a driver:
column4: identify dangerous driving situations and take action to avoid an accident.
column6: defend against accidents by driving your vehicle fast enough to stay ahead of traffic congestion.
column8: defend against poor drivers by getting ahead of them in traffic.
column10: defend yourself against accidents by following close to the vehicle ahead.

column2: 8. When driving on a wet road:
column4: as you decrease your speed, the road becomes more slippery.
column6: as you drive faster, your tires may lose traction.
column8: you must be aware that the pavement gets even more slippery when it's been raining for long periods of time.
column10: you should follow the vehicle ahead of you more closely.

column2: 9. What should you do if a vehicle is approaching head-on in your lane?
column4: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other driver.
column6: Pull over to the left and use your emergency lights to stop the other driver.
column8: Come to a complete stop and use your horn to warn the vehicles behind you.
column10: Turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.

column2: 10. If your car starts to skid, turn your steering wheel:
column4: to keep the front wheels straight.
column6: in the direction you want to go.
column8: in the opposite direction of the skid.
column10: in any direction. It doesnt matter.

column2: 11. A red traffic signal light means that you must:
column4: when there is no stop line, stop before entering any crosswalk.
column6: stop at the stop line.
column8: where there is no stop line or crosswalk, stop before entering the intersection.

column2: 12. Whenever you change your residence address you:
column4: don't have to do anything.
column6: must notify the county examiner of drivers in writing within 30 days after the change.
column8: must notify the county examiner of drivers when renewing your license.
column10: must notify the county examiner of drivers only when you buy a new car.

column2: 13. You can pass on the right:
column4: when passing is restricted by parked cars.
column6: when a vehicle that is approaching from the opposite direction is prepared to turn left.
column8: when a vehicle ahead makes a right turn.
column10: when a vehicle ahead makes a left turn.

column2: 14. Drivers should give bicyclists:
column4: the same rights and privileges as motorists.
column6: the right of way when crossing bike lanes.
column8: twice as much room as the driver thinks the bicyclist needs.

column2: 15. When approaching a railroad crossing drivers should:
column4: look for a train.
column6: slow down.
column8: be ready to stop.

column2: 16. You can reduce the chance of a collision with a large vehicle if you:
column4: pay close attention to the turn signals.
column6: cut abruptly in front of it.
column8: pull in front of the large vehicle before you can see the whole front of the vehicle in your mirror.

column2: 17. What type of pavement marking shows you which lane you must use for a turn?
column4: Crosswalk Lines
column6: Diamond
column8: Arrows

column2: 18. This road sign means:
column4: A road joins from the left
column6: The road ahead turns sharply right then sharply left
column8: Winding road ahead

column2: 19. This sign means:
column4: road construction.
column6: lane ends, merge left.
column8: narrow bridge ahead.

column2: 20. The best way to deal with tailgaters is to:
column4: slow down to encourage the tailgater to pass.
column6: pump your brakes to get them to back off.
column8: ignore them completely.
column10: speed up to increase the space between you and the tailgater.

column2: 21. What does a yellow arrow signal mean?
column4: Vehicles moving in all directions must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column6: The same as a green light.
column8: The same as the yellow light, but applies only to movement in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 22. When you get in a car to drive, the first thing you should do is:
column4: adjust your seat belt.
column6: check your rear view mirror.
column8: adjust your seat.

column2: 23. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.
column6: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.
column8: be ready to stop at the stop sign.
column10: stop doing what they are doing.

column2: 24. A road is likely to be most slippery:
column4: when tire marks have been left by other vehicles.
column6: in cold, dry weather.
column8: in spring.
column10: when icy and the temperature is near freezing.

column2: 25. This road sign means:
column4: Divided highway ahead
column6: You can travel in either direction in this lane
column8: Two-way traffic ahead

column2: 26. What should you do when an aggressive driver confronts you?
column4: Make eye contact.
column6: Return gestures and shouts.
column8: Challenge the aggressive driver with increased speed.
column10: Avoid eye contact with the aggressive driver.

column2: 27. Before crossing any railroad tracks, you must:
column4: make sure there is room for your vehicle on the other side.
column6: look and listen for trains.
column8: wait until the crossing gates are completely up.

column2: 28. Warning signs normally are:
column4: rectangles.
column6: octagons.
column8: triangles.

column2: 29. You are turning onto a two-lane road divided by a broken yellow line. You know that:
column4: you must stay to the left of the broken yellow lines.
column6: the road is under repair.
column8: you are on a one-way road.
column10: you are on a two-way road.

column2: 30. These are:
column4: speed limit signs.
column6: miles-left signs.
column8: route signs.
